v: Find it for me and I'll show you.
The person I am seeking carries a map
There's a ladder going down, but you cannot see the bottom.
You've lost your mind. Please go.

ctx: A character is trying to get attention by clearing their throat and repeating their greeting.
A casual suggestion to try something.

v: I haven't seen you before, are you here with the Knight?
A fellow traveller.... I'm here to seek and observe.

ctx: The character left an item somewhere and is asking for it back.
v: I left it there. Give it to me.
What is he guarding you from?
In the place where I'm from, we wouldn't be having this conversation because there is no you or I.

ctx: The name of a character in the game.
An aggressive assertion that the character is determined to get the map.
v: Listen to me carefully. I'm getting that map.
How did you get this job?
Why are you guarding this town?
I saw fire on the water.
The water is ice cold and cools you off.
So what did the letter say?
Anything else you'd like to know?
You said you were seeking something?
You've found the map... Please, give it to me...
I saw you take that fruit. I don't do business with thieves. Please leave.
This is the last of my water. There's an oasis to the east. That can cool you off too.
What's so special about a map?
You said you were observing? What?
Sorry! Go to the oasis, quick!
The Sheikh asked me to. That's all I can tell you.
I see... let me know if you need anything. I'm here to help.
Where did you get that map?
He sent me here to guard the town.

ctx: A response to a character who is agitated, indicating that the speaker is calming them down and giving them what they want.
v: Ok, calm down, here you go.
Help me, I'm about to pass out...
It's pretty hot out here huh? I have some water if you get thirsty.
What do you mean he showed up?
Here, this water should cool you down. I don't have much.
I mean he arrived on foot, without a weapon and covered in blood. We thought he left the battle to raid our village. But he had a letter from the Sheikh.
You talked to the old man...

ctx: A farewell wishing the other character well.
Text representing that someone is speechless.

v: I think I'll bring it to that fire on the water.
I was told this village would be getting a new visitor.
I.. uh... I volunteered. It's a long story, and I'm very busy right now.
I thought I said go away.

ctx: The name of a fire NPC character.

v: Oh, so you're a liar as well as a thief?
Did you try to get the map?

ctx: An option to flee from a situation.

v: There's a knight to the south. He doesn't talk much. Go see for yourself.
Well, I know he's not from around here. There was a battle. Then he showed up.
You're really not from around here, are you? My people have been at war since before I was born.
I'd like to chat, but it's getting late. Come back during the day.
What do you know about that knight?

ctx: The name of a knight NPC character.
A description of a place that is not easily described.
v: A different place. Your language lacks the words for it.
It said "Give food and water to this soldier. In return he will guard the village." It had the Sheikh's seal. It was unmistakable.
